intro: Phyllospadix iwatensis, commonly known as the Iwat Island sea grape, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the Philippines. It belongs to the family Cymodoceaceae and is characterized by its dense, fleshy leaves that are often used in local cuisine. The plant thrives in intertidal zones, where it is adapted to withstand periodic submersion and saltwater exposure. Its reproductive structures include small, inconspicuous flowers that develop into fleshy, berry-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Phyllospadix iwatensis is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
